intro: Rumicastrum cylindricum, commonly known as the cylindrical rumiaceae, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through features such as succulent stems and reduced leaf surfaces. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
